corejs.note_html: This feature is supported when using Babel with core-js.

optional.note_html: This feature features requires an optional transformer setting.

regenerator.note_html: This feature requires native generators or regenerator-runtime, it's a part of babel-polyfill or babel-runtime.

corejs.note_html: This feature is supported when using TypeScript with core-js.

fallthrough.note_html: TypeScript's compiler will accept code using this feature if the --target ES6 flag is set, but passes it through unmodified and does not supply a runtime polyfill.

notDownlevelIteration.note_html: Does not work with the downlevelIteration compile option.

experimental.note_html: Flagged features have to be enabled via "Enable experimental Javascript features" setting under about:flags

sharedmem.note_html: The feature have to be enabled via javascript.options.shared_memory setting under about:config. It is enabled by default in Firefox Developer Edition and Firefox Nightly builds.

nomob.note_html: The feature is available on desktop versions only, it is not available on mobile versions yet.

developer.note_html: The feature is available only in Firefox Developer Edition and Firefox Nightly builds.

nightly.note_html: The feature is available only in Firefox Nightly builds.

bigint.note_html: The feature have to be enabled via javascript.options.bigint setting under about:config.

classFields.note_html: The feature have to be enabled via javascript.options.experimental.fields setting under about:config.

privateClassFields.note_html: The feature have to be enabled via javascript.options.experimental.fields setting under about:config. Private fields are supported by parser, but behave as public fields.

sharedmem.note_html: The feature have to be enabled via "Experimental enabled SharedArrayBuffer support in JavaScript." setting under about:flags

experimental.note_html: The feature have to be enabled via "Experimental Javascript features" setting under about:flags

harmony.note_html: The feature have to be enabled via --js-flags="--harmony" flag

tco.note_html: The feature is considered unstable, but can be enabled via --js-flags="--harmony-tailcalls" flag

promise.note_html: The feature is considered unstable, but can be enabled via --js-flags="--harmony-promise-finally" flag

simd.note_html: The feature is considered unstable, but can be enabled via --js-flags="--harmony-simd" flag

stringPrototypeReplaceAll.note_html: The feature is considered unstable, but can be enabled via --js-flags="--harmony-string-replaceall" flag

templateStringsPermanentCaching.note_html: Safari 12 caches TemplateStrings using a GC-able "CodeBlock". But TemplateStrings are supposed to always be identical! When the CodeBlock is reclaimed, the TemplateStrings' identity is broken. Thankfully, [[Call]] vs [[Construct]] generate different CodeBlocks, which exposes the broken behavior.

sparseNote.note_html: Internet Explorer 6 - 8 do not differentiate between a dense array with undefined values, and a sparse array. Specifically, `0 in [,]` and `0 in [undefined]` both yield false - whereas in a compliant browser, the former would give `false`, the latter `true`. As such, ES5 array iteration methods can only be shimmed reliably when dealing with dense arrays.
